intro: Pouzolzia quadrialata, commonly known as the four-angled pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has opposite, four-angled leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white in color and arranged in clusters. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
